document_data.name: Qudra
document_data.caption: A map showing mighty Qudra on the coast in north Zakhara.
document_data.government: elected monarchy (vassal to the Grand Caliph)
document_data.mainbody: '''Qudra''', or the '''City of Power,''' was a major power in the northern reaches of [[Zakhara]].
document_data.Description: Qudra was a model of duty and organization. It overlooked the [[Great Sea]] from the mouth of [[Al-Faddi River]]<ref> about {{SI|300|mi|k|long=yes}} northwest of [[Hiyal]]. Qudra served as Zakhara's bastion against the [[Zakharan pantheon|unenlightened]] lands outside its borders. The city's fortifications were increased over a long history of pirate raids and barbarian incursions. As of [[1367 DR]]{{AQ-time}}, Qudra had the strongest bulwarks in all of Zakhara, presenting a stern gray face to the north.
document_data.History: Qudra was ruled by [[Mamluk]]s who were fiercely devoted to the [[Khalil al-Assad al-Zahir|Grand Caliph]] in [[Huzuz]]. It was considered one of the three great cities of [[Zakhara]].<ref>  This city was noted for its well run and well-treated slave market, its mamluks, armor, and trade in northern goods.
